nodes.text: A mission to Obredaan was launched in 32 BBY in response to the failure of a previous mission. Jedi Obi-Wan Kenobi and Qui-Gon Jinn were assigned to rescue Jedi Masters Plo Koon and Eeth Koth from the Jin'ha. They then discovered the Jin'ha were mining cortosis and stole a sample before escaping.

In 32 BBY, Jedi Padawan Obi-Wan Kenobi fought mercenaries and Jin'ha warriors on Coruscant. He defeated the arms dealers before they started a war on the planet. The Jedi High Council then sent two Jedi Masters, Plo Koon and Eeth Koth, to Obredaan to investigate the Jin'ha. After contact was lost, the council then sent Kenobi and his master, Qui-Gon Jinn, to rescue the two Jedi.
Kenobi and Jinn fought through a group of Jin'ha warriors and snipers to find the wreckage of the Jedi's spaceship.

Kenobi and Jinn then infiltrated the Jin'ha mining camp. While Jinn rescued the two masters, Kenobi discovered that the Jin'ha were mining cortosis and stole a sample of the metal, which was able to block the weapon of the Jedi, the lightsaber. The four Jedi rendezvoused outside of the camp and defeated the remaining warriors. Plo Koon later revealed that he had noticed large-scaled production facility during his captivity.

A Trade Federation gunship then flew overhead, suggesting to the Jedi a link between the Trade Federation and the Jin'ha. Kenobi and Jinn debriefed the Jedi Council, and Windu told them the Council would directly deal with the Jin'ha, as the implications of weapons able to combat the Jedi were disturbing. A few weeks later, the Trade Federation betrayed the Jedi Council's trust and blockaded the planet of Naboo. Further investigation by Kenobi revealed that the Jin'ha were in fact mining cortosis for the Trade Federation. Jinn and Kenobi were assigned to secret negotiations with the Federation leadership.
The second mission to Obredaan appears in the 2001 video game Star Wars: Obi-Wan. The mission was later mentioned in 2008's The Complete Star Wars Encyclopedia.
